item.title: Calculate softmax
item.description: Calculate softmax $\sigma(\vec{z})i = \frac{e^{z_i}}{\sum{j=1}^{K}e^{z_j}}$ from math import exp import numpy as np z = [13, 9, 9] np.round(np.exp(z)/sum(np.exp(z)),2) array([0.96, 0.02, 0.02])

item.title: Check from CLI if Jupyter is running and kill it
item.description: Check what is running and kill it For tensorflow and pytorch, you need gcc8 to compile code which is not the system default. Do the following to use gcc8: jupyter notebook list jupyter notebook stop 8888

item.title: Check package versions
item.description: Check deep learning library versions !python -c "import tensorflow as tf; print('Tensorflow:', tf.__version__)" !python -c "import torch; print('Pytorch:', torch.__version__)" Tensorflow: 2.3.1 Pytorch: 1.7.0

item.title: Profiling GPU with Nvidia tools
item.description: Using Nsight systems To install Nsight systems: Download from Nvidia Make executable with chmod a+x NsightSystems-linux-public-2020.5.1.85-5ee086b.run install with ./NsightSystems-linux-public-2020.5.1.85-5ee086b.run Add to path export PATH="/home/othrif/setup/nsight-systems-2020.5.1/target-linux-x64:$PATH" Run profiling tool with: nsys profile ./program Using nvida-smi nvidia-smi -l 1 >> gpu-stats.out

item.title: Standard includes
item.description: Basic includes for TensorFlow import os import pathlib import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np import seaborn as sns import tensorflow as tf from tensorflow.keras.layers.experimental import preprocessing from tensorflow.keras import layers from tensorflow.keras import models from IPython import display # Set seed for experiment reproducibility seed = 42 tf.random.set_seed(seed) np.random.seed(seed)
